main event: Two objects were observed in Hale, Michigan on 11 November 1964, one black and one orange, with the orange object breaking away from the black one.
interesting points: The observation lasted between 3 to 10 seconds., The orange object appeared to be burning and had a tail likened to a flame., The flight path of the objects was straight with no maneuvering., Local military aircraft were not flying at the time of the sighting., Queries to local stations about the sighting yielded negative responses.
sighted object: one black object and one orange object
witness description: Marie R. Thornty, 23, school teacher, and Eugene L. Thornton, Captain, 442nd FIS, pilot.
